author: Redacción LAVOZ
title: Inundaciones en Brasil: en Porto Alegre, algunas personas tuvieron que moverse usando lanchas
text: Las [terribles inundaciones que sufrió Brasil en la última semana](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/mundo/brasil-108-muertos-sigue-la-lluvia-y-hay-un-cierre-indefinido-del-aeropuerto-de-porto-alegre/) dejaron increíbles imágenes y secuencias. La tragedia, que ya se cobró la vida de más de 100 personas, aparejó un sinfín de historias particulares que dieron la vuelta al mundo. En la ciudad de Porto Alegre, en las últimas horas se viralizó un video que sorprendió a más de uno. Es que las inmediaciones del estadio de Gremio están totalmente inundadas y anegadas por el agua, lo que derivó en que las personas debieran moverse a bordo de vehículos acuáticos. [La secuencia impacta](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/mundo/el-conmovedor-rescate-de-un-hombre-y-sus-cuatro-perritos-durante-las-inundaciones/) y se puede ver las calles de Porto Alegre convertidas prácticamente en canales tras la inundación. El video Inundaciones en Brasil: el emotivo rescate de un perro Un perro fue rescatado en un operativo policial en medio de las [fuertes inundaciones que azotan a Brasil](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/mundo/la-tragedia-climatica-en-rio-grande-do-sul-en-brasil-ya-suma-90-muertos-y-miles-de-dramas/). Los rescatistas grabaron el momento en el que el animal se aferraba fuertemente a unos centímetros de muro para no ser arrastrado por la corriente. La Policía de Porto Alegre se encuentra en medio de un gran despliegue de búsqueda de personas en medio de la crisis desatada por las inundaciones. El [ Gobierno de Brasil estableció el estado de calamidad](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/mundo/el-gobierno-de-brasil-establece-el-estado-de-calamidad-en-336-municipios-por-las-lluvias/) en 336 de los 496 que conforman el estado meridional de Río Grande do Sul. Los niveles de agua sin precedentes se deben a las fuertes precipitaciones que cayeron estos últimos días. En medio de las tareas de rescate, la Policía logró dar con el perro el cual se apoyaba sobre la parte superior de una medianera en un intento por sobrevivir a la grave crecida. En el video viral difundido en las redes, se observa cómo el perrito se sujetaba a la parte superior del muro como apoyo. Con miedo y los músculos tensos por el esfuerzo, el perrito fue finalmente sujetado por los rescatistas. Ya sobre la embarcación, el animal se recostó y, luego, pareció apoyarse sobre el pie del policía que lo salvó. El compañero del oficial comenzó a acariciarlo, mientras el animal se volvió un perro más auxiliado en medio de los graves desbordamientos hídricos que sufre el país.

author: @Dailyhuntapp
title: PoK people themselves will want to join India, no need for force: Rajnath Singh
text:
'India-China talks going well'
The talks with China are going well. We hope for a resolution. They (Chinese side) also have hope and that is why we are holding talks.
Pak ex-minister's 'praise' of Rahul worrisome
Former Pakistani minister Chaudhry Fawad Hussain's praise of Rahul Gandhi is a matter of grave concern. The Congress must explain the deep love for its leader from a country that has always tried to destabilise India.
In an exclusive interview, Rajnath asserted that the ground situation had improved significantly in Jammu and Kashmir and that a time would come when AFSPA (Armed Forces Special Powers Act) would no longer be required in the UT.
The Defence Minister, however, said the matter was under the domain of the Union Home Ministry and it would take appropriate decisions. He said elections would also be held there definitely. He, however, didn't give a timeline.
"I think India will not have to do anything. The way the ground situation has changed in Jammu and Kashmir, the way the region is witnessing economic progress and the way peace has returned there, I think people of PoK will demand that they want to merge with India," he said.

author: Dominique LANDRON
title: Culture - Loisirs - À Zonza : l'appel culturel de Zonz'art ! pour célébrer la Résistance
text:
La commission des affaires culturelle de la commune de Zonza Santa Lucia di Portivechju, sous la responsabilité de Jeannine Maestrati, qui a en charge de la culture organise une exposition artistique intitulée Zonz'art ! le 12 juillet à Zonza. Un appel à artistes (peintres, sculpteurs, photographes…) est lancé.
Il s'adresse aux artistes locaux afin de pouvoir engager la créativité autour du thème de la Résistance. Jeannine Maestrati explique sa démarche : "Après les trois éditions d Arte in Pinareddu direction les cimes de l'Alta Rocca, la montagne, en devenant Zonz'art ! L'objectif de cet évènement est de créer un espace de dialogue entre artistes émergents et artistes confirmés, ainsi qu'avec le public. Zonza est le symbole de la Résistance avec la mémoire de Jean Nicoli prestigieux fils de notre commune, son musée, le groupe scolaire de Santa Lucia di Portivechju…"
Résistances au pluriel
Mais pour la responsable de l'événement, "résistance", prend ici plusieurs dimensions : "Au-delà de la Libération de la Corse dont on a fêté l'an dernier les 80 ans, et des événements de 2024 liés aux 81 ans de la Libération de la France, d'autres pistes s'offrent à nous. Le mot "résistance" se décline dans de nombreuses et diverses expressions. Le statut de la femme au sein notre société avec le mouvement #MeToo, les conditions de travail de plus en plus difficiles au sein d'un monde en perpétuelle évolution, l'explosion des cellules familiales, etc. Je laisse aux futurs concurrents leur imagination au service la création. La liberté en culture permet à la jeune génération, et à la plus ancienne aussi, d'exprimer son talent dans toutes les dimensions et expressions artistiques. Il sera passionnant de comparer leurs regards."
Une vitrine de talents
L'objectif pour ce concours est d'être une véritable vitrine des talents qui se cachent pour différentes raisons. Par pudeur notamment, en se considérant de fait "oubliés", alors qu'ils sont en réalité bienvenus.
 Jeanne Maestrati est sensible à ce constat : "Les gens de ce territoire hésitent à s'exprimer en public, pourtant le terroir est riche de ces artistes amateurs qui ont du talent. Que vous soyez peintre, sculpteur ou photographe, nous vous encourageons à soumettre votre candidature*. Notre commune met en avant tout au long de l'année la culture avec des conférences, des concerts et expositions. En août, nous accueillerons les œuvres d'Alain Moro à la MJC Casa per tutti, et je tiens à souligner, insiste Jeanne Maestrati, l'importance de maintenir un équilibre entre mer et montagne tout au long de l'année, y compris en matière de culture."
Tout est dit, place désormais à votre imagination pour nourrir cette future exposition estivale. Modalités : votre biographie artistique (200 mots max), explication de démarche artistique (300 mots max), des visuels de vos œuvres (5 images max, en format jpeg). Ainsi que tout autre argument que vous jugerez pertinent. La date limite de dépôt du dossier est le lundi 27 mai à l'adresse : culture@zonza.corsica.

author: Pat Mueller
title: Padres FanFest canceled due to expected rain, event honoring Seidler moved up
text: SAN DIEGO (KGTV) — The San Diego Padres have canceled its FanFest event on Sunday, March 24, due to predictions of heavy rain and possible thunderstorms in the forecast. Additionally, the team has rescheduled the celebration of life ceremony honoring Peter Seidler, the team's [late chairman and owner,](https://www.10news.com/sports/padres/padres-chairman-and-owner-peter-seidler-dies#:~:text=Seidler%20passed%20away%20Tuesday%20in,calling%20Peter%20a%20beloved%20owner.) to an earlier time on Saturday. Saturday's ceremony at Petco Park will begin at 11 a.m. Home Plate Gate will open to the public at 10 a.m., and seating will be available on a first-come, first-served basis. Parking in Padres lots, including the Lexus Premier Lot, Tailgate Lot and Padres Parkade, will be free of charge. The event will also be streamed live on the [Padres website](https://www.mlb.com/padres). Fans who had tickets for the Sunday event can redeem up to four free tickets to either Monday or Tuesday's exhibition games against the Seattle Mariners at Petco Park. This offer lasts while tickets are still available. First pitch for Monday's game is slated for 6:40 p.m., while Tuesday's game has a 1:10 p.m. start time. You can [follow this link](https://www.mlb.com/padres/fans/fanfest) to claim your tickets. RELATED STORIES:

author: Jesús David Castellano
title: Francia remontó y derrotó a la Vinotinto del futsal
text:
La selección Vinotinto dirigida por Robinson Romero disputó este jueves su segundo partido del Mundial de la FIFA Uzbekistán 2024, y pese a que mostró mejor juego que en el choque inaugural, no pudo evitar caer por marcador de 7-3 ante Francia en el Complejo Deportivo Universal de Bujará.
Lee también: Ivan Perisic firma contrato con el PSV
El combinado europeo se adelantó a los 5:23 de partido por intermedio de Nicolás Menendez, pero a partir del minuto 13′, Venezuela fue capaz de darle vuelta con tantos de Kevin Briceño y Jesús Viamonte.
A partir de ahí el partido se convirtió en un ida y vuelta, con ocasiones para ambos equipos. Pero, Francia se fue arriba mediante goles de Ayoub Saadaqui y Kevin Ramírez. Y, pese a que Venezuela igualó nuevamente con golazo de media volea de Kevin Briceño, el conjunto galo sacó la casta y aprovechó su superioridad física para terminar de abultar el resultado.
Los goles finales fueron de: Mamadou Toure (25:49), Nelson Lutin (32:13), Kevin Ramírez (37:38) y Sid Belhaj (38:58).
Ahora, la “Vinotinto” solo puede optar por avanzar como uno de los mejores tercero. Aunque, no depende de si mismo, tiene que ganarle a Guatemala y esperar otros resultados.
Ese partido será este domingo a las 11:00 AM en el Humo Arena en Tashkent, donde Venezuela parte como último del Grupo F al tener un diferencial de goles de -10.

author: Yahoo Life Shopping
title: Boric Says Chile Is Poised for Economic Comeback on Investment and Jobs
text:
Bloomberg Boric Says Chile Is Poised for Economic Comeback on Investment and Jobs Matthew Malinowski January 1, 2024 at 2:19 AM · 2 min read 1 Link Copied Read full article Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. More content below
(Bloomberg) -- Chile President Gabriel Boric said the nation’s gross domestic product will grow strongly next year now that the economy has stabilized, laying the groundwork for more investment and jobs.
Most Read from Bloomberg
Strong Earthquake Hits Northwestern Japan, Destroying Homes
Maersk Halts Red Sea Shipping as US Navy Sinks Houthi Boats
India’s Crude Oil Imports From Russia Plunge on Payment Issues
USS Gerald R. Ford to Leave the Eastern Mediterranean, ABC Says
Putin Says He Wants Peace in Ukraine But on Russia’s Own Terms
The economy has cooled down without harming society’s most vulnerable, and the administration achieved a key public-private partnership to help develop the local lithium industry, Boric said in a year-end speech on Sunday. The government will continue to work for better jobs and salaries, he said.
Read more: Chile’s SQM Reaches Lithium Mining Accord With Codelco
“The country didn’t fall into recession like some people predicted insistently, and next year Chile will grow with strength,” Boric said.
Boric is working to revive growth in one of Latin America’s richest economies at the end of a year marked by high interest rates and uneven demand. The central bank is cutting borrowing costs, while officials woo investment to industries including lithium and green hydrogen. Still, politics are polarized after a failed push to rewrite the constitution, and unemployment is high.
“If in politics we are capable of leaving the trenches, listening to one another and putting the country and its people above all other considerations, then I am sure we can achieve important agreements,” Boric said, calling for advances on his administration’s pension and tax reform proposals.
Finance Minister Mario Marcel has reiterated expectations that GDP will expand by 2.5% in 2024 after remaining flat in 2023. By comparison, analysts surveyed by Bloomberg see Chile’s economy growing 1.9% next year, which would be faster than the regional average.
Boric ended 2023 with 31% approval, according to a Cadem public opinion survey published earlier on Sunday.
Most Read from Bloomberg Businessweek
On The Businessweek Show: What Audiences Actually Want to Watch
Elon Musk Made 2023 All About Himself

author: Our Editors
title: 9 Effective Supplements For Postpartum Hair Loss
text:
9 Effective Supplements For Postpartum Hair Loss
The Good Trade editors endorse products we’ve personally researched, tested, and genuinely love. Learn more about our methodology and business model here.
Our editors have tested and researched dozens of vitamins, supplements, and serums to help with postpartum hair loss — these are our favorite picks with clean and safe ingredients.
Let’s be transparent: Hair loss — especially a few months after pregnancy — is common. As bodies adjust to new hormone levels and growth cycles, it’s normal to notice hairs falling out more often. But it’s not as easy as just acknowledging this; hair loss can impact our self-confidence and body image — and our mental health, too.
If you’re dealing with postpartum hair loss, first know that you’re not alone. Secondly, there are natural supplements that can help. We’ve rounded up our favorites below, many of which use all-natural ingredients, are manufactured here in the US under strict safety and health guidelines, and are safe for breastfeeding parents.
Why does postpartum hair loss happen?
Postpartum hair loss is incredibly common due to the hormonal changes that occur during and after pregnancy. Plummeting estrogen levels can make our hair shed and lead to noticeable loss — and the added fatigue and stress only exacerbate this situation. Add in nutritional deficiencies from breastfeeding, and, well, our hair seems to fall out at an alarming rate, which can be worrisome as we reach for any sort of normalcy in the postpartum stage. Fortunately, this hair loss is generally temporary, and as our hormones stabilize, new baby hairs and growth come in (if you know, you know!). The below supplements can help aid in this growth, which is why we love them.
What vitamins help with hair growth?
Look for ingredients like biotin, folate/folic acid, and vitamins B6 and B12 — they are considered the most important in hair growth and are almost all included in the formulas below. If you don’t see a recommended ingredient listed on a product label, we recommend reaching out to the brand just to make sure!
Our criteria:
- NATURAL/ORGANIC | We look for vitamins and supplements with natural and organic ingredients and prioritize brands with third-party certifications.
- EFFICACY | We’ve tested many of the brands below ourselves for postpartum hair loss and to help with overall growth. All our recommendations are backed by reviews to ensure you’re getting a product that works.
- AFFORDABLE | Cost is a number-one factor for a lot of folks, so we’ve included a range of price points here.
For more postpartum essentials, here are our must-haves for the fourth trimester.
1. Ritual
Best For | Postnatal support capsules
Natural Ingredients | Vitamin A, B12, C, D, E, folate, zinc, biotin, magnesium, iron, vegan DHA
Price | $39 for 60 capsules (two daily); subscriptions available
Our bodies are already going through a number of changes postpartum, not just hair loss. Ritual’s Postnatal Multivitamin accounts for that, with extra nutrients our bodies need throughout lactation and the first 6 months postpartum. From microalgae and vitamin B12 for brain health to zinc for immunity to biotin and folate for luscious locks, you can look to this all-in-one for whole-body support. The capsules are fully traceable, non-GMO, and vegan — and Ritual itself is a certified B Corp that equally prioritizes people, planet, and profit.
Customer Review | “[A] great product! [I] love it” – Rand A. (Read all reviews.)
2. Prose
Best For | Custom hair supplements
Natural Ingredients | Vitamin B complex, zinc, turmeric extract, spirulina, grape seed extract, hibiscus extract (varies by formula)
Price | $62 for 30-day supply (two daily); discounted subscriptions available
Prose is best known for its custom shampoos and conditions that can be tailored to your needs, and the team has expanded into custom hair supplements now, too, for the most effective results. The “Custom Root Source™” regimen contains two capsules — the first is personalized just for you, and the second is made with Prose’s trademarked complex (PureCatalyst), formulated to reduce shedding and promote growth. Using plant-based ingredients like sesame seed, saffron, and turmeric, each blend takes its cues from nature so it’s about as clean as can be. Prose is a certified B Corp, so these supplements are cruelty-free, vegan, globally sourced, and blended in the US. Enjoy stronger, shinier hair and thoughtful business practices.
3. Vegamour
Best For | Vegan biotin gummies
Natural Ingredients | Tapioca syrup, cane sugar, vitamins A, B5, B6, B12, C, E, biotin
Price | $36 for 30 vitamins (one daily); discounted subscriptions available
If taking multiple pills a day is too much, we recommend Vegamour’s GRO Biotin Gummies instead. This all-vegan formula leverages powerhouse ingredients like biotin, folic acid, and vitamin C to grow healthier hair — and support the scalp. You only need one gummy a day, and you can expect visible results as soon as the third month (check out some of the reviews that show progress in just one!). Cruelty-free, clinically tested, and color-safe, we love how intentional this formula is — and that a little goes a long way. Sign up for a monthly subscription to save an additional 16% plus free shipping.
Customer Review | “I had to get a bob due to bleach damage and my hair typically grew very very slow and I had first started off with the serum but it was hard to keep up with so I switched over to the gummies( they’re delicious !) and I cannot believe how much my hair has grown and no matter how many times I’ve dyed my hair my hair still shines. I originally took pictures for me to see if there was any difference and I’m so glad I did to share my experience !(:” – Kimberly R. (https://www.jdoqocy.com/click-7880526-13786891?sid=wel-web-pg-&url=https%3A%2F%2Fvegamour.com%2Fproducts%2Fgro-biotin-gummies.)
4. Nutrafol
Best For | Physician-formulated capsules
Natural Ingredients | Organic rice hulls, hydrolyzed marine collagen, ashwagandha, hyaluronic acid, fruit extracts, vitamin A, C, D, E, biotin, zinc, selenium, iodine
Price | $88 for 120 capsules (four daily); discounted subscriptions available
Between its many five-star ratings, the 2021 NewBeauty award, and recommendations from dermatologists, Nutrafol is considered a miracle worker for postpartum hair loss. The formula is crafted by physicians and packed with natural ingredients to promote thicker, fuller hair within 3-6 months. While the ingredients do contain fish (in the marine collagen), it’s free of dairy, soy, gluten, and GMOs — and there’s a Women’s Vegan option too that uses plant-based ingredients. By targeting the root causes of hair loss, Nutrafol’s supplements will bring life back to your hair — the science proves it!
Customer Review | “Nutrafol has turned my hair around. It’s much thicker and longer than its been in a very long time.” – Laura (https://nutrafol.com/nutrafol-core-for-women/.)
5. Natalist
Best For | Affordable gummies
Natural Ingredients | Organic tapioca syrup, organic cane sugar, vitamins C & E, zinc, biotin, hydrolyzed collagen
Price | $30 for 60 gummies (two daily)
Natalist wants to support every stage of your reproductive health journey, from prenatal vitamins to postpartum gummies. The Biotin Plus Gummies were specifically made for moms dealing with hair loss, and they don’t just benefit your strands, but your overall health, too. Each gummy includes biotin of course, but there’s also hydrolyzed collagen, vitamins for antioxidant and immune system support, and organic sweeteners to go easy on the belly. And as for Natalist’s ethics? The brand is 100 percent plastic-neutral, manufactured in the US, and all products are FDA-registered. You’re two gummies a day away from your healthiest skin and hair.
6. Perelel
Best For | Multi-support pill packs
Natural Ingredients | Vitamins A, C, D, E, B12, B6, K, DHA & EPA, biotin, choline, bovine collagen peptides, ashwagandha, L-theanine
Price | $59 for 30 pill packs (one daily); discounted subscriptions available
Formulated by leading OB/GYNs, Perelel‘s Mom Multi is a comprehensive postnatal vitamin routine designed to support moms up to five years postpartum. This daily packet includes a multivitamin, omega DHA + EPA, a beauty blend, and an anti-stress blend, all clinically proven to support overall health, heart health, emotional balance, and hair, skin, and nail health. The blend includes choline for postpartum health, biotin for hair and nail support, and collagen for skin elasticity, providing essential nutrients for new moms experiencing postpartum hair loss. It’s also gluten-free, dairy-free, soy-free, and non-GMO, ensuring high-quality, no-nausea ingredients for optimal wellness.
Customer Review | “After having my first baby I felt so sluggish and cranky, my hair was thinning, and my skin was breaking out badly. Immediately after having my second baby I started taking the mom multi support pack and I’ve noticed a huge difference in how I feel and look. My mood and energy levels are better and my skin, hair, and nails, are much healthier. I feel like I’m thinking more clearly as well. Really great product.” – Annabel F. (https://perelelhealth.sjv.io/c/274622/1911933/22949?subId1=bm-web--&u=https%3A%2F%2Fperelelhealth.com%2Fproducts%2Fmom-multi-support-pack.)
The Good Trade Partner
7. Divi
Best For | Scalp serum
Natural Ingredients | Copper tripeptide-1, caffeine, tea tree oil, amino acids, hyaluronic acid
Price | $48 for 30-day supply; discounted subscriptions available
If you prefer serums for hair growth rather than adding another daily capsule to your rotation, check out Divi‘s Scalp Serum. This clinically-tested serum focuses on creating a healthy scalp environment rather than just treating existing hair. (So you can experience new and healthy scalp growth!) With daily use, 90% of users saw their hair looking fuller, and 87% noticed increased density, thanks to the powerful mix of amino acids, caffeine, peptides, and rosemary oil. Plus, it’s vegan, cruelty-free, and made in the USA!
Customer Review | “I experienced hair loss from hormonal issues and this has helped grow back all that was lost!!!! Love love Divi” – Rebekah M. (https://rstyle.me/+6lxhDgZ_lRaEguLLGCsvFA.)
8. Wellbel
Best For | Doctor-formulated vegan capsules
Natural Ingredients | Betaine HCI, saw palmetto, MSM, biotin
Price | $68 for 30-day supply (three daily); discounted subscriptions available
Wellbel makes vegan physician-formulated daily supplements designed to support hair, skin, and nail health for both men and women. This proprietary blend features science-based vegan ingredients like betaine HCI for protein digestion, saw palmetto for hormone health and hair follicle support, and MSM for antioxidant synthesis and collagen production. Unlike other supplements with high biotin doses that can cause breakouts, Wellbel contains a balanced 500mcg of biotin to promote healthy hair growth without side effects. With consistent daily use, these supplements can lead to visible results within 90 days!
Customer Review | “I have been taking Wellbell for over a year now (since last June) and I have not skipped a day of my three pills a days regimen. My hair is thicker and longer than ever. The texture of my hair has even changed. Not to mention my nails are stronger. Everyone asks me how I got my hair to grow- I always recommend wellbell- a few of my friends and family have started their wellbell journey!” – Alicia M. (https://wellbel.com/products/wellbel-women.)
9. Moon Juice
Best For | Bioavailable vegan hair multivitamin
Natural Ingredients | SuperHair complex, pumpkin seed powder, horsetail, ashwaganda, saw palmetto, kelp
Price | $83 for 30-day supply (four daily); discounted subscriptions available
SuperHair is a powerhouse multivitamin with Moon Juice‘s special blend that promotes healthier, stronger, and thicker hair by targeting four key areas: Stress, nutrient deficiencies, follicle protection, and hair micronutrients. It’s packed with bioavailable vitamins like A, B, C, D3, and E, plus adaptogens such as organic ashwagandha, which balance stress hormones and reduce hair thinning. The Moon Juice blend also includes botanicals like saw palmetto and pumpkin seed to protect hair follicles, while horsetail and biotin support strength and smooth texture. With a subscription option and compostable refills, it’s a sustainable way to supercharge your hair health!
Customer Review | “I’ve been taking SuperHair religiously for a little over a year now and have seen exponential strengthening and growth! Not only is my hair growing faster and stronger and looks more vibrant but my nails are less brittle (as I work with my hands often) and my skin has more elasticity and glow. It’s like a souped-up multi-vitamin!! My partner has even started taking them as one of her prenatal vitamins. I’m so grateful for such clean, well-sourced vitamins.” – Liberty R. (https://moon-juice.pxf.io/c/274622/1443879/17153?subId1=wel-web--&u=https%3A%2F%2Fmoonjuice.com%2Fen-ca%2Fproducts%2Fsuperhair.)
Featured image is from Vegamour
